name: Google - Dark header
description: A style which colors the background of Google's search result <s>and service header</s>, where Google+ information also resides.
additional_info: This update comes after I figured out what I had to do to accommodate what some people might want when using the style linked below. I re-used the regexp string from it for a lazy fix people can enable at will to not have these changes applied to the Google Search and Google Images front pages. May require end-user tweaking. You may want to install this first if you are looking for the code to add a background image to Google (image) search's front page. This style was created to give users the capability to make the Google interface more darker, and indirectly to allow use of dark backgrounds in Google Web and Google Images by making the name of the present Google+ user white. 05/21/2014 Okay, so I fixed it well enough for now, but it will be update later on today. Also deleted old update history because it was starting to look sad and none of it was dated. I also added share highlight text preferences, just because I was sick of pushing another class-changing update. Google logo remains untouched because of a doodle presently in use; When Google changes it back, it will be using a different class. 06/23/2014 Corrected update log... I think. Due to familial issues, I cannot work on CSS like I use to. Don't fret about me quitting; I have not. I will continue to work on my styles and fight for user rights to see the web how they want to see it through continued updating against the well-funded war machine that is the Googleplex. Also, I lied in the last update log, sorry about that. 06/23/2014 Class changes 06/27/2014 Class changes, image positioning changes 06/29/2014 Class changes, slight cleanup. 07/02/2014 Class change. 07/04/2014 Class change. 07/08/2014 Class changes. 07/12/2014 Class change. 07/21/2014 Class changes and value changes to account for a new image used in Google's webpage. 07/30/2014 Class changes, and some code-neatening. If something looks messed up, send a private message. 08/26/2014 Okay, this requires a little explanation. There has not been a tectonic plate shift in the Google verse, so I could knock this out in a matter of minutes. Why the long wait then? I was involved in other projects outside of here. Shame on me. Anyway, here's the update! Just some class changes, and the removal of some classes that didn't look necessary anymore. 09/11/2014 Class changes, background position changes for icons. Never forget. 09/22/2014 Class changes. 09/26/2014 The straw that broke the camel's back was Google using different images for the same interface buttons. I had enough, so I uploaded a copyof one of their interface images to imgur and with the help of frecyber from the userstyles.org forums, I figured out how to make the image I wanted to use work. Also, class change for font color. 10/14/2014 Projects, projects, projects. Lots of things I am doing is detracting from my time of doing CSS stuff, but here's the new official update. 10/27/2014 More distractions in my life, nd also more things Google is doing in its code. Fortunately with the exclusion of the "Share" text this style has become a bit easier to manage, but only marginally. 11/15/2014 Class changes. 12/07/2014 Class changes. 12/16/2014 Google decided to quit making small changes and instead make my life a little bit more miserable. Nonetheless I found a way around their changes. 01/16/2015 Class changes. 02/10/2015 Class changes. Sorry it took so long, I don't visit Google every day!
